params._proposalId: The ID of the proposal to be checked.

returns._0: True if the proposal can be executed, false otherwise.

params._actions: The actions that will be executed after the proposal passes.
params._data: The additional abi-encoded data to include more necessary fields.
params._endDate: The end date of the proposal.
params._startDate: The start date of the proposal.

customProposalParamsABI().details: Used for UI to easily detect what extra params the contract expects.

params._proposalId: The ID of the proposal to be executed.

hasSucceeded(uint256).details: Note that this must not include time window checks and only make a decision based on the thresholds.

returns._0: Returns if proposal has been succeeded or not without including time window checks.

proposalCount().details: This function is deprecated but remains in the interface for backward compatibility.      It now reverts to prevent ambiguity.

canExecute(uint256).notice: Checks if a proposal can be executed.

customProposalParamsABI().notice: The human-readable abi format for extra params included in `data` of `createProposal`.

proposalCount().notice: Returns the proposal count which determines the next proposal ID.

documentation.text:
@notice Emitted when a proposal is executed.
 @param proposalId The ID of the proposal.

@notice Executes a proposal.
 @param _proposalId The ID of the proposal to be executed.
